segment.source: QUERY OBJ
segment.target: QUERY OBJ

segment.source: QUERY OBJ
segment.target: QUERY OBJ

segment.source: QUERY OBJ
segment.target: QUERY OBJ

segment.source: Returns a tab-delimited list of current applications, packages, file type associations, or publishing servers.
segment.target: Returns a tab-delimited list of current applications, packages, file type associations, or publishing servers.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: APP
segment.target: APP

segment.source: Returns a list of applications.
segment.target: Returns a list of applications.

segment.source: PACKAGE
segment.target: PACKAGE

segment.source: Returns a list of packages.
segment.target: Returns a list of packages.

segment.source: TYPE
segment.target: TYPE

segment.source: Returns a list of file type associations.
segment.target: Returns a list of file type associations.

segment.source: SERVER
segment.target: SERVER

segment.source: Returns a list of publishing servers.
segment.target: Returns a list of publishing servers.

segment.source: /SHORT
segment.target: /SHORT

segment.source: Without displaying the full properties of each, returns a list of application names, packages, associations, or server names.
segment.target: Without displaying the full properties of each, returns a list of application names, packages, associations, or server names.

segment.source: /GLOBAL
segment.target: /GLOBAL

segment.source: For applications, returns all known applications instead of only the ones the current user has access to.
segment.target: For applications, returns all known applications instead of only the ones the current user has access to.

segment.source: For packages, returns all known packages instead of only the ones the current user has access to.
segment.target: For packages, returns all known packages instead of only the ones the current user has access to.

segment.source: For associations, returns only associations that apply to all users, not user-specific ones.
segment.target: For associations, returns only associations that apply to all users, not user-specific ones.

segment.source: Not valid for servers.
segment.target: Not valid for servers.

segment.source: /LOG
segment.target: /LOG

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.

segment.source: /CONSOLE
segment.target: /CONSOLE

segment.source: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).
segment.target: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).

segment.source: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.

segment.source: /LOGU
segment.target: /LOGU

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In version 4.6, a new column has been added to the output of SFTMIME QUERY OBJ:APP /GLOBAL.
segment.target: In version 4.6, a new column has been added to the output of SFTMIME QUERY OBJ:APP /GLOBAL.

segment.source: The last column of the output is a numeric value that indicates whether an application is published or not.
segment.target: The last column of the output is a numeric value that indicates whether an application is published or not.

segment.source: PUBLISHED=1 means the application was published by a Publishing Server refresh, by installing the application by using a Windows Installer file (.MSI), or by running an SFTMIME ADD PACKAGE, CONFIGURE PACKAGE or PUBLISH PACKAGE command by using a package manifest.
segment.target: PUBLISHED=1 means the application was published by a Publishing Server refresh, by installing the application by using a Windows Installer file (.MSI), or by running an SFTMIME ADD PACKAGE, CONFIGURE PACKAGE or PUBLISH PACKAGE command by using a package manifest.

segment.source: PUBLISHED=0 means the application has not been published or it is no longer published as a result of performing a Clear operation or running an SFTMIME UNPUBLISH command.
segment.target: PUBLISHED=0 means the application has not been published or it is no longer published as a result of performing a Clear operation or running an SFTMIME UNPUBLISH command.

segment.source: If you use the /GLOBAL parameter, the PUBLISHED state will be 1 for applications that were published globally and 0 for those applications that were published under user contexts.
segment.target: If you use the /GLOBAL parameter, the PUBLISHED state will be 1 for applications that were published globally and 0 for those applications that were published under user contexts.

segment.source: Without the /GLOBAL parameter, a PUBLISHED state of 1 is returned for applications published in the context of the user running the command, and a state of 0 is returned for those applications that are published globally.
segment.target: Without the /GLOBAL parameter, a PUBLISHED state of 1 is returned for applications published in the context of the user running the command, and a state of 0 is returned for those applications that are published globally.

segment.source: The SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command can be used to query for information on all of the objects shown above—applications, packages, file type associations, and servers.
segment.target: The SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command can be used to query for information on all of the objects shown above—applications, packages, file type associations, and servers.

segment.source: To show how you might use the SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command in your normal operations tasks, the following example demonstrates the process you would follow if you wanted to set the OVERRIDEURL parameter value for a specific package to specify a new path to the package content.
segment.target: To show how you might use the SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command in your normal operations tasks, the following example demonstrates the process you would follow if you wanted to set the OVERRIDEURL parameter value for a specific package to specify a new path to the package content.

segment.source: To find the package that you want to configure, run the following command:
segment.target: To find the package that you want to configure, run the following command:

segment.source: This command returns each discovered package name as a GUID in the first column of output—for example, {AF78ABE1-57D4-4297-89DE-C308684AEDD6}.
segment.target: This command returns each discovered package name as a GUID in the first column of output—for example, {AF78ABE1-57D4-4297-89DE-C308684AEDD6}.

segment.source: To set the OVERRIDEURL parameter value, you use the SFTMIME CONFIGURE PACKAGE command.
segment.target: To set the OVERRIDEURL parameter value, you use the SFTMIME CONFIGURE PACKAGE command.

segment.source: For example, to set the OVERRIDEURL value for this package to a value of serversharemypackage.sft, use the SFTMIME CONFIGURE PACKAGE command and give it the selected package GUID from the output of the SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command in step 1, followed by the OVERRIDEURL parameter and its new value, as follows:
segment.target: For example, to set the OVERRIDEURL value for this package to a value of serversharemypackage.sft, use the SFTMIME CONFIGURE PACKAGE command and give it the selected package GUID from the output of the SFTMIME QUERY OBJ command in step 1, followed by the OVERRIDEURL parameter and its new value, as follows:

segment.source: For version 4.6 SP2, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6 SP2, the following option has been added.

segment.source: /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT
segment.target: /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT

segment.source: Indicates the current state of the /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT flag.
segment.target: Indicates the current state of the /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT flag.

segment.target: Related topics
